types.name: Query
types.description:
Root Query type

Combines all query fields from different modules:
- ProductQueries: Comprehensive product operations
- CategoryQueries: Category operations
- CartQueries: Shopping cart operations
- OrderQueries: Order management operations
- PuckDataResolvedQuery: Theme puck data with resolved section data
- DiscountQueries: Discount validation and info
- CheckoutQueries: Checkout operations (shipping, tracking)
- StoreSettingsQueries: Public store settings (WhatsApp, etc.)
- PaymentQueries: Available payment methods

fields.name: availablePaymentMethods
fields.description: Get available payment methods for checkout

fields.name: storeSettings
fields.description: Get public store settings (name, WhatsApp, currency, etc.)

fields.name: availableShippingRegions
fields.description: Get available shipping regions with prices for current cart

fields.name: trackOrder
fields.description: Track order by order number + phone (secure, no authentication required)

fields.name: validateDiscountCode
fields.description: Validate discount code before applying to cart

fields.name: publicPuckDataResolved
fields.description: Fetch active theme's puck data with resolved section data for storefront (uses X-Store-Hostname header for workspace identification)

fields.name: categories
fields.description: Browse categories with filtering and pagination

fields.name: category
fields.description: Get single category details by slug

fields.name: categoryById
fields.description: Get single category details by ID

fields.name: categoriesBySlugs
fields.description: Get specific categories by their slugs

fields.name: categoryProducts
fields.description: Get products from a specific category with filtering

fields.name: categoryCount
fields.description: Get count of categories matching criteria

fields.name: products
fields.description: Browse published products with filtering and pagination

args.name: search
args.description: Search products by name, description, or brand

fields.name: product
fields.description: Get single product details by slug with variants

fields.name: productById
fields.description: Get single product details by ID

fields.name: relatedProducts
fields.description: Get products related to a specific product

fields.name: productCount
fields.description: Get count of products matching criteria

types.name: AvailablePaymentMethodType
types.description:
Public payment method info for storefront checkout

Security: Only exposes public info (no credentials)
Usage: Payment method selector in checkout

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: StoreSettingsType
types.description:
Public store settings for storefront display

Security: Only exposes customer-facing settings
Usage: Header, footer, checkout, contact pages

types.name: AvailableShippingRegions
types.description:
Available shipping regions query result

Returns list of regions with calculated shipping costs
for current cart products

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: ShippingRegionType
types.description:
Shipping region with pricing information

Used by frontend to display shipping options dropdown
Each region shows total shipping cost and estimated delivery

fields.name: price
fields.description: Total shipping cost for this region in XAF

types.name: Decimal
types.description: The `Decimal` scalar type represents a python Decimal.

types.name: OrderTrackingType
types.description:
Limited order info for public tracking
Used for order tracking without authentication

types.name: DateTime
types.description:
The `DateTime` scalar type represents a DateTime
value as specified by
[iso8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

types.name: DiscountValidationType
types.description: Result type for discount code validation

types.name: PuckDataResolvedResponse
types.description: Response type for resolved puck data query

types.name: JSONString
types.description:
Allows use of a JSON String for input / output from the GraphQL schema.

Use of this type is *not recommended* as you lose the benefits of having a defined, static
schema (one of the key benefits of GraphQL).

types.name: CartType
types.description:
GraphQL type for Cart model

Performance: Uses prefetch_related for items optimization

fields.name: sessionId
fields.description: Unique session identifier for guest carts

types.name: Node
types.description: An object with an ID

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: CartItemType
types.description:
GraphQL type for CartItem model

Performance: Uses select_related for product optimization

fields.name: priceSnapshot
fields.description: Price at time of adding to cart

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: ProductType
types.description:
Comprehensive Product type matching admin model structure

Themes can query only the fields they need
All fields match admin model exactly

fields.name: allowBackorders
fields.description: Allow orders when out of stock

fields.name: package
fields.description: Shipping package for this product (optional - falls back to default if not set)

fields.name: mediaUploads
fields.description: Uploaded images for this product in upload order

types.name: WorkspaceStoreProductProductTypeChoices
types.description: An enumeration.

enumValues.name: PHYSICAL
enumValues.description: Physical Product

enumValues.name: DIGITAL
enumValues.description: Digital Product

enumValues.name: SERVICE
enumValues.description: Service

types.name: WorkspaceStoreProductStatusChoices
types.description: An enumeration.

enumValues.name: PUBLISHED
enumValues.description: Published

enumValues.name: DRAFT
enumValues.description: Draft

types.name: CategoryType
types.description:
GraphQL type for Category model - Collections in storefront

Matches admin model structure exactly
Themes can query only the fields they need

fields.name: isVisible
fields.description: Whether collection is visible to customers

fields.name: isFeatured
fields.description: Whether collection is featured on homepage

fields.name: sortOrder
fields.description: Manual sort order for admin drag-drop

types.name: MediaUploadType
types.description:
Media Upload GraphQL Type - URL-focused design

Returns:
- Direct URLs (not nested objects)
- Minimal metadata
- Optimized for frontend consumption

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Additional metadata (format, duration for videos, etc.)

types.name: UUID
types.description:
Leverages the internal Python implementation of UUID (uuid.UUID) to provide native UUID objects
in fields, resolvers and input.

types.name: MedialibMediaUploadMediaTypeChoices
types.description: An enumeration.

enumValues.name: IMAGE
enumValues.description: Image

enumValues.name: VIDEO
enumValues.description: Video

enumValues.name: A_3D_MODEL
enumValues.description: 3D Model

enumValues.name: DOCUMENT
enumValues.description: Document

types.name: BigInt
types.description:
The `BigInt` scalar type represents non-fractional whole numeric values.
`BigInt` is not constrained to 32-bit like the `Int` type and thus is a less
compatible type.

types.name: MedialibMediaUploadStatusChoices
types.description: An enumeration.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: Pending

enumValues.name: PROCESSING
enumValues.description: Processing

enumValues.name: COMPLETED
enumValues.description: Completed

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: Failed

enumValues.name: ORPHANED
enumValues.description: Orphaned

types.name: WorkspaceStoreProductInventoryHealthChoices
types.description: An enumeration.

enumValues.name: HEALTHY
enumValues.description: Healthy

enumValues.name: LOW
enumValues.description: Low Stock

enumValues.name: CRITICAL
enumValues.description: Critical

enumValues.name: OUT_OF_STOCK
enumValues.description: Out of Stock

types.name: PackageType
types.description:
GraphQL type for Package model

Features:
- Simple shipping package configuration
- Region-based fees stored in JSON (multiple regions per package)
- Cameroon-specific flexibility

fields.name: regionFees
fields.description: Shipping fees by region in XAF format: {'yaounde': 1500, 'douala': 1200, 'buea': 1000}

fields.name: useAsDefault
fields.description: Use this package as default fallback for products without shipping

types.name: WorkspaceStorePackagePackageTypeChoices
types.description: An enumeration.

enumValues.name: BOX
enumValues.description: Box

enumValues.name: ENVELOPE
enumValues.description: Envelope

enumValues.name: SOFT_PACKAGE
enumValues.description: Soft Package

types.name: WorkspaceStorePackageSizeChoices
types.description: An enumeration.

enumValues.name: SMALL
enumValues.description: Small

enumValues.name: MEDIUM
enumValues.description: Medium

enumValues.name: LARGE
enumValues.description: Large

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: ProductVariantType
types.description:
Comprehensive ProductVariant type matching admin model structure

Used when theme supports variant selection
All fields match admin model exactly

types.name: ImageType
types.description:
Image type with WebP support and multiple variations

Provides optimized images for different use cases:
- url: Original uploaded image
- optimized/optimized_webp: 1200px for product pages
- thumbnail/thumbnail_webp: 300px for product cards
- tiny/tiny_webp: 150px for list views

Frontend usage:
- Storefront: Use optimized_webp (best performance)
- Product cards: Use thumbnail_webp
- List views: Use tiny_webp

types.name: AppliedDiscountType
types.description:
Applied discount details for cart display

Lightweight type showing only customer-facing discount info

types.name: ItemDiscountType
types.description: Individual item discount breakdown for buy_x_get_y and amount_off_product

fields.name: edges
fields.description: Contains the nodes in this connection.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: The Relay compliant `PageInfo` type, containing data necessary to paginate this connection.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: When paginating backwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: When paginating forwards, the cursor to continue.

types.name: CategoryTypeEdge
types.description: A Relay edge containing a `CategoryType` and its cursor.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination

fields.name: edges
fields.description: Contains the nodes in this connection.

types.name: ProductTypeEdge
types.description: A Relay edge containing a `ProductType` and its cursor.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination

types.name: Mutation
types.description:
Root Mutation type

Combines all mutation fields from different modules:
- CartMutations: Shopping cart operations
- CheckoutMutations: Checkout and order creation
- CustomerAuthMutations: Customer signup/login/logout
- CustomerProfileMutations: Customer profile management
- DiscountMutations: Discount application and removal

fields.name: applyDiscountToCart
fields.description:
Apply discount code to cart

Performance: Atomic transaction with proper locking
Security: Validates discount before application

fields.name: removeDiscountFromCart
fields.description:
Remove discount from cart

Performance: Atomic transaction

fields.name: applyAutomaticDiscounts
fields.description:
Apply best automatic discount to cart

Performance: Evaluates all automatic discounts and applies best one

fields.name: updateCustomerProfile
fields.description:
Consolidated profile update mutation

Updates profile, addresses, and preferences in ONE operation
All parameters are optional - update only what you need

Cameroon Market: Phone-first, mobile-optimized, single atomic operation

fields.name: getCustomerProfile
fields.description:
Get customer profile data

Returns complete profile with addresses, preferences, and order stats

fields.name: getCustomerOrders
fields.description:
Get customer order summary

Returns order statistics (total orders, total spent, etc.)

fields.name: customerSignup
fields.description:
Customer signup with password - Phone-first approach

Security: Password is hashed using Django's make_password
Creates customer account and returns session token

fields.name: customerLogin
fields.description:
Customer login with password - Phone-first authentication

Security: Password verification with check_password
Validates customer credentials and returns session token

fields.name: validateCustomerSession
fields.description:
Validate customer session token

Used to check if session is still valid and get customer data

fields.name: createWhatsappOrder
fields.description:
Create WhatsApp order mutation

Performance: < 200ms with proper locking
Security: Comprehensive input validation
Reliability: Atomic transaction, no race conditions

fields.name: createCodOrder
fields.description:
Create cash on delivery order mutation

Performance: < 200ms with proper locking
Security: Comprehensive input validation
Reliability: Atomic transaction, no race conditions

fields.name: createPaymentOrder
fields.description:
Create payment order mutation (Fapshi, mobile money, etc)

Performance: < 200ms with proper locking
Security: Comprehensive input validation
Reliability: Atomic transaction, no race conditions

fields.name: createCart
fields.description:
Create new guest cart and session

Security: Rate limited to prevent abuse
Performance: Atomic transaction

fields.name: addToCart
fields.description:
Add product to cart with variant support

Performance: Uses select_for_update to prevent race conditions
Security: Validates stock availability

fields.name: updateCartItem
fields.description: Update cart item quantity with variant support

fields.name: removeFromCart
fields.description: Remove item from cart with variant support

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
